docs.lead_paragraph: Burning as few as 150 calories a day by walking the dog, washing the car, working in the garden and climbing the stairs can reduce the risk of heart disease, high blood pressure, cancer and diabetes, according to the first Surgeon General's report on physical activity, issued today. In place of trips to the gym or the jogging track, the report says, a moderate level of exercise can be achieved by doing any of a number of ordinary chores at a brisk pace. But, it says, the majority of Americans simply do not perform them.
